page.title: 08 Keith Railway Station
page.content: Keith Railway Station lies on the north side of the town near the River Isla and adjacent to Kynoch's Wool Mills. The railway station stands on the main Aberdeen to Inverness railway line. A branch line also runs from Keith to Dufftown but this is mainly used by distillery traffic and there is no passenger service although in summer, excursion trains from Aberdeen run occasionally. The station is operated by British Rail. On average, around 20 trains arrive and leave Keith each day. Approximately five freight wagons arrive at Keith daily carrying a variety of goods including mail, parcels, newspapers, coal, timber and raw materials for the distilleries. Between 50 and 70 passengers travel from Keith daily, making it busy for a small town station.
